IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHAUTAUQUA OPPORTUNITIES, INC.'S MISSION IS TO LEAD THE FIGHT AGAINST POVERTY BY MOBILIZING RESOURCES AND CREATING PARTNERSHIPS TO PROMOTE EMPOWERMENT, ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE AND OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CHAUTAUQUA OPPORTUNITIES, INC.'S MISSION IS TO LEAD THE FIGHT AGAINST POVERTY BY MOBILIZING RESOURCES AND CREATING PARTNERSHIPS TO PROMOTE EMPOWERMENT, ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE AND OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: EARLY EDUCATION AND YOUTH SERVICES - PROVIDE EDUCATION TO FAMILIES AND THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH PROGRAMS SUCH AS HEAD START AND UNIVERSAL PRE-K.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT - PROVIDE SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW INCOME PERSONS, AS WELL AS PROVIDED ASSISTANCE IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF OTHER SERVICES. SPECIFIC PROGRAMS INCLUDE SECTION 8 HOUSING CHOICE VOUCHER, WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE, AND VA SUPPORTIVE SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: YOUTH SERVICES - PROVIDE RESIDENTIAL AND ASSET DEVELOPMENT SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH SUCH PROGRAMS AS YOUTH SAFEHOUSES, AFTER-SCHOOL, AND RESPITE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: HEALTH SERVICES - PROGRAM PROVIDES ADULT AND SENIOR HOME AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES: EXPENSES, 905,201; PROGRAM FEE REVENUES, 468,266. CHILD CARE COUNCIL - PROGRAM INCLUDES CHILD CARE, REFERRALS AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES: EXPENSES, 837,335; PROGRAM FEE REVENUES, 120,893. ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT - PROGRAM PROVIDES ECONOMIC COUNSELING TO INDIVIDUALS AS MEANS TO IMPROVE ASSISTANCE IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF OTHER SERVICES: EXPENSES, 36,009; PROGRAM FEE REVENUES, 1,540. CENTRAL SERVICES - CHARGES/FEES TO ORGANIZATION'S FUNDED PROGRAMS FOR PROVIDED ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER SERVICES, 986,205. EXPENSES OF 2,920,852 AS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PAGE 10, PART IX, COLUMN (C).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VOLUNTEERS INCLUDED PARENTS OF CHILDREN AND OTHERS IN THE HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START/CHILD CARE PARTNERSHIP PROGRAMS AND INDIVIDUALS SERVING ON THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

HEALTH SERVICES - PROGRAM PROVIDES ADULT AND SENIOR HOME AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES: EXPENSES, 905,201; PROGRAM FEE REVENUES, 468,266. CHILD CARE COUNCIL - PROGRAM INCLUDES CHILD CARE, REFERRALS AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES: EXPENSES, 837,335; PROGRAM FEE REVENUES, 120,893. ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT - PROGRAM PROVIDES ECONOMIC COUNSELING TO INDIVIDUALS AS MEANS TO IMPROVE ASSISTANCE IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF OTHER SERVICES: EXPENSES, 36,009; PROGRAM FEE REVENUES, 1,540. CENTRAL SERVICES - CHARGES/FEES TO ORGANIZATION'S FUNDED PROGRAMS FOR PROVIDED ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER SERVICES, 986,205. EXPENSES OF 2,920,852 AS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PAGE 10, PART IX, COLUMN (C).
A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW, IN EITHER PAPER OR ELECTRONIC FORMAT. AFTER REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE FORM 990 IS FILED.

ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE BOARD MEMBERS AND MANAGEMENT. SUCH STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD. BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM ANY BUSINESS BROUGHT BEFORE THE BOARD WITH AN ENTITY OR MATTER TO WHICH THEY ARE RELATED OR HAVE A CONFLICT.

THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE, COMPRISED OF MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, RECOMMENDS THE COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND VOTE. NO DIRECTOR WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST CAN BE INVOLVED IN THE RECOMMENDING OR APPROVING OF THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT. THE COMMITTEE UTILIZES AVAILABLE DATA FOR COMPARISON PURPOSES IN THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE ARRANGEMENT. WRITTEN SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION REGARDING THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT ARE MAINTAINED.
THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND EXEMPT ORGANIZATION FILINGS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE OFFICES OF THE ORGANIZATION.

PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENT FOR DISALLOWED HEAD START COSTS IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FISCAL YEAR ENDED OCTOBER 31, 2015. THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZED INCOME OF 131,750 IN FYE 10/31/2015 FOR SUCH COSTS. IN JANUARY 2018, THE U.S, DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES INFORMED THE ORGANIZATION OF THE DISALLOWANCE AND THE REQUIREMENT TO REPAY THE FUNDING RECEIVED.
